column4: hey i installed something from an executable and now i want to uninstall it
but it doesn't show up in my package manager
how do i do that
genii can i use gksudo with bash?
better not. To get a root shell, use 'sudo -i' in a terminal.
interactive (man sudo)
don't manipulate the installation like that. Better use a package manager to install/remove software
i can't do that with this program
which one is it?
well, you'll probably have to remove all directories and menu entries manually
use alacarte
menu editor
that depends on the package
yeah
erusul do you guys use tetex?
I wrote my thesis using tetex, but switched to texlive halfway
i'm trying to use texmaker with tetex
just remove all of texmaker you can find without too much trouble. Then install texlive
on top of tetex?
no, it'll automatically replace tetex
what was your thesis in?
medical image analysis
what kind of analysis? analytical, graphical, mathematical?
anatomical segmentation of brain MR images
